comment: Dr. Yannuzzi was a pleasure. He challenges you to think critically and analyze the course content. This is an upper level course, and students aren't used to not having everything handed to them. If you like going through the motions in college and not learning actual lessons that will be useful after graduation, you won't like his course.

I honestly believe this man goes out of his way to make your life harder than it already is. He treats it as an audit class when we are already in an audit class that actually matters to us. Team communication made me cry on multiple occasions. His grading is ridiculous. Thanks Professor, for making my life hell.

This class was tough. The content is not hard, but the tests and assignments are. Two test, paper, and group presentation. He does not post grades so you won't know what you have until final grades. He is a nice guy, but he takes this class VERY seriously. I would suggest not buying the book, everything you need is in the PowerPoints.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: He's caring, if he sees students trying. Horrible with grading assignments on time. Exams are tough, because he switches the testing method without notice. First exam, multiple choice with essay questions. Second exam, all short answers/essays. He will grade you for participating in class discussions.

rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS--Tests are tough

comment: Get ready to work and be frustrated. Yannuzzi is very nice, but he makes this class more difficult than it needs to be. His tests and quizzes are very tough and he gives no guidelines for the paper and presentation. I put in A LOT of effort and I still ended with a B. The group work is not bad, it's just his grading that makes this class tough!

His class is not easy. You have to be prepared to UNDERSTAND the materials. You CANNOT get a good grade in his class by memorization. It is about understanding and applying to what he asks in the tests. He wants you to "learn" and not care so much about grades so if that is the kind of teacher you want, then go for him. Many found his class HARD.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS--Tests are tough

comment: He is a nice guy, but he makes this class is very difficult. The topic is easy and interesting, but his exams are a monster. They include 10 multiple choice where there can be more than 1 right answer, 10 definitions, and 4 to 15 discussion / free response questions. He does not explain the expectations for the paper and project so just wing it.

This was a very frustrating class. The tests are tough and he gives no study guides or review. Read the chapters and study the Power Points to pass. The group project is the most challenging part. He assigns groups and you are to discuss a social issue. He expects so much from us but gives no rubrics or criteria for any assignments.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS--Tests are tough

comment: I took him for my communications class. There is required reading, but that just goes along with the course. He tells you everything that will be on the test and grades very fairly. Very intellectual and good at teaching the material
